content:
• Friday, September 9, 2011
  • SCEIQ

    Brock SIlvers - a member of the Board of Directors of Sino Clean Energy (SCEI) who served on the...

    Brock SIlvers - a member of the Board of Directors of Sino Clean Energy (SCEI) who served on the audit committee - has resigned after the Board rejects his suggestion for the formation of a special group to investigate fraud allegations at the company. Shares -8.5% AH after falling 4.7% in the regular session.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • PNW

    It was a rough ride for sleepy utility stocks after California's biggest power blackout in...

    It was a rough ride for sleepy utility stocks after California's biggest power blackout in years. The source appears to be a faulty transmission line operated by Arizona Public Service (PNW -2.9%), but the brunt of the outage was felt by customers of Sempra Energy’s (SRE -2.7%) San Diego Gas & Electric. Other California power companies felt investors' wrath: PCG -2.4%, EIX -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • TXN

    Some of Texas Instruments' (TXN +1.5%) competitors are joining the company in outperforming...

    Some of Texas Instruments' (TXN +1.5%) competitors are joining the company in outperforming following TI's mid-quarter update. MXIM +0.7%. LLTC +0.3%. SMTC +0.4%. MRVL +2.2%. Memory vendors Micron (MU +2%) and Sandisk (SNDK +0.7%) are also up, perhaps due to reports of improving NAND flash prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • AABA

    "You've got fail." AOL shares zip right back down as CNBC reports a source close to Yahoo (YHOO)...

    "You've got fail." AOL shares zip right back down as CNBC reports a source close to Yahoo (YHOO) saying the firm has no interest in a deal. AOL -4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 3 Comments
  • PHM

    Homebuilders are getting clobbered again today: PulteGroup (PHM -4.2%), D.R. Horton (DHI -3.4%),...

    Homebuilders are getting clobbered again today: PulteGroup (PHM -4.2%), D.R. Horton (DHI -3.4%), KB Home (KBH -6.6%), Lennar (LEN -4.2%), Meritage Homes (MTH -6%), Toll Brothers (TOL -3.1%), Ryland (RYL -6.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • TTM

    Tata Motors (NYSE:TTM) drops 10.1% after the Indian carmaker announces the resignation of CEO...

    Tata Motors (NYSE:TTM) drops 10.1% after the Indian carmaker announces the resignation of CEO Carl-Peter Forster, just 18 months after he joined the company. Shares could also be getting hit by a report that Indian car sales fell 10% Y/Y in August, hurt by higher costs and rising interest rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • MT

    Global steel giant ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) is down 8.1% after announcing the idling of a liquid...

    Global steel giant ArcelorMittal (NYSE:MT) is down 8.1% after announcing the idling of a liquid steel production facility in France, just days after idling a plant in Germany. Analyst Anthony B. Rizzuto thinks the company is smart to shut down its higher-cost European facilities, given weak global demand and high raw material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • OMX

    It's another tough day for shares of firms selling office supplies. OfficeMax (OMX -7.2%),...

    It's another tough day for shares of firms selling office supplies. OfficeMax (OMX -7.2%), Staples (SPLS -3.1%) and Office Depot (ODP -5.7%) are all coming off the GS retailers conference where guidance, comments and jawboning did little to enthuse investors. The only surprise may have been Staples' CEO Ron Sargent's prediction of major consolidation within the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • AOL

    AOL +1.5% spikes higher after Bloomberg reports the company is in talks with Yahoo (YHOO -1.4%)...

    AOL +1.5% spikes higher after Bloomberg reports the company is in talks with Yahoo (YHOO -1.4%) about a possible combination.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • HFC

    Buybacks appear to be losing some of their luster, especially on days like today. HollyFrontier...

    Buybacks appear to be losing some of their luster, especially on days like today. HollyFrontier (HFC -3.3%) sells off in spite of its announcement of a $100M stock repurchase after the close yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO -4%) is down today after Goldman downgrades the shares to sell on valuation, citing...

    Tesoro (TSO -4%) is down today after Goldman downgrades the shares to sell on valuation, citing concerns over margin pressure in the company's West Coast refineries.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • AATI

    Advanced Analogic (AATI -29.2%), which announced a merger agreement with Skyworks (SWKS -2.9%)...

    Advanced Analogic (AATI -29.2%), which announced a merger agreement with Skyworks (SWKS -2.9%) in May, is plunging after Skyworks discloses it's filed a formal notice of breach (page 12) regarding the agreement, accusing Advanced Analogic of failing to disclose requested business information.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (SODA -4.1%) loses its fizz today, following a +26% run to the upside over the past...

    Sodastream (SODA -4.1%) loses its fizz today, following a +26% run to the upside over the past week. The recent bounce comes after getting pummeled in August when the company reduced guidance. Oppenheimer is out defending the shares, saying this is a good opportunity to buy into weakness.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • VHI

    Shares of Valhi (VHI -4.2%) fall off with other chemical manufacturers, giving back some of the...

    Shares of Valhi (VHI -4.2%) fall off with other chemical manufacturers, giving back some of the stock's impressive 33% monthly gain. According to a SEC filing the company's Chairman of the Board remains bullish, picking up more shares to add to his stake in the firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • INTC

    Like fellow chipmakers Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) and Fairchild (FCS) earlier this week, Texas...

    Like fellow chipmakers Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) and Fairchild (FCS) earlier this week, Texas Instruments (TXN +1.2%) is outperforming after lowering its Q3 guidance. During TI's mid-quarter update call, management reported seeing "broadly lower demand," though the company's OMAP mobile processors and DLP projector chips remain areas of strength.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-IO (FIO +1.2%) finally reverses course after a three day downward trend following a...

    Fusion-IO (FIO +1.2%) finally reverses course after a three day downward trend following a stinger of an initiation from Auriga with its Sell rating. Storage stocks sit as one of the few brights on the day, poking out some meager gains in a wave of selling.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • MYRX

    Myrexis (OTC:MYRX -2.8%) is down today after after reporting a wider FQ4 loss and saying it's...

    Myrexis (OTC:MYRX -2.8%) is down today after after reporting a wider FQ4 loss and saying it's suspended any further development of its lead drug candidate Azixa.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • PLD

    Warehouse owner ProLogis (PLD -3.8%) is lower today after disclosing Thursday the sale of eight...

    Warehouse owner ProLogis (PLD -3.8%) is lower today after disclosing Thursday the sale of eight wholly owned assets, as well as its interest in the ProLogis Korea fund.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • BUNL

    The 10 year U.S. Treasury yield dips to 1.896%, the lowest rate in at least 60 years. The German...

    The 10 year U.S. Treasury yield dips to 1.896%, the lowest rate in at least 60 years. The German 10 year Bund - at 1.77% - is also at a record low. Since its introduction in late March, the German Bund ETN BUNL +13.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • REGN

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -9.1%) sink after double downgrades: to Underperform...

    Shares of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -9.1%) sink after double downgrades: to Underperform from Neutral at Bank of America and to Market Perform from Outperform at Leerink Swann, which cited the need for improved visibility on the launch of its blindness drug Eylea.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • HILL

    Dot Hill Systems (HILL -5.5%) says it's working with ipCapital Group to evaluate strategic...

    Dot Hill Systems (HILL -5.5%) says it's working with ipCapital Group to evaluate strategic alternatives for its patent portfolio - consisting of 79 patents and 23 patents pending - covering data storage, storage software, servers and connectivity.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • KFY

    Staffing firm Korn/Ferry (KFY -12.4%) gets slammed after reporting in line FQ1 earnings late...

    Staffing firm Korn/Ferry (KFY -12.4%) gets slammed after reporting in line FQ1 earnings late yesterday, but lowering FQ2 EPS guidance. It now expects $0.30 to $0.36 per share, on the low end of expectations. Separately, Deutsche also cut its estimates on the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (TZOO +2.9%) CEO Chris Loughlin says in a statement that the company has had no...

    Travelzoo (TZOO +2.9%) CEO Chris Loughlin says in a statement that the company has had no contact with ChaPaVe Partners, the investment firm that announced a plan to bid $40/share for 1.5M shares. Shares have pulled back from earlier gains.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • ASYS

    Amtech Systems (ASYS +1%) is higher this mornng after the company pulled its $60M shelf...

    Amtech Systems (ASYS +1%) is higher this mornng after the company pulled its $60M shelf registration, saying it has more than sufficient cash to manage current operations.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • CLNE

    Shares of Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -7.5%) slip, following a familiar see-saw pattern seen in the...

    Shares of Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE -7.5%) slip, following a familiar see-saw pattern seen in the stock over the last month. A SEC 13-G filing shows the company is taking on passive investors from Singapore and Cayman Islands via 7.5% convertible notes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • BGCP

    BGC Partners (BGCP +2%) bucks the downtrend after KBW ups the shares to outperform on valuation,...

    BGC Partners (BGCP +2%) bucks the downtrend after KBW ups the shares to outperform on valuation, citing the company's solid earnings growth potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • YTEN

    Bioscience research firm Metabolix (MBLX +2.6%) trades higher this morning after Piper Jaffray...

    Bioscience research firm Metabolix (MBLX +2.6%) trades higher this morning after Piper Jaffray ups the shares to neutral on valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • TUWLF

    Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWLF +19%) and Shell (RDS.A -1.4%) announce positive results from their 1st...

    Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWLF +19%) and Shell (RDS.A -1.4%) announce positive results from their 1st wildcat well in the Zaedyus field off the coast of French Guiana. "The importance of this discovery cannot be overstated," says an analyst, who believes Tullow might be sitting on 3.5B barrels of hydrocarbons.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • SPEX

    Microcap biopharmaceutical company Spherix (SPEX +105%) soars after saying that its drug...

    Microcap biopharmaceutical company Spherix (SPEX +105%) soars after saying that its drug candidate, SPX-106, achieved statistically significant reductions in VLDL and LDL cholesterol when administered to genetically engineered mice prone to dyslipidemia.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) is up 2.4% on the day, as StreetInsider.com reports the...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) is up 2.4% on the day, as StreetInsider.com reports the company is rumored to be the "mystery stock" hedge fund kingpin Bill Ackman recently hinted about.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • LUX

    Luxottica (LUX -3.5%) trades lower after HSBC cuts it to underweight, citing concerns about its...

    Luxottica (LUX -3.5%) trades lower after HSBC cuts it to underweight, citing concerns about its overweighted North American exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • MCD

    The disappointing global sales report from McDonald's (MCD -3.8%) is partially attributable to...

    The disappointing global sales report from McDonald's (MCD -3.8%) is partially attributable to Hurricane Irene, says Telsey Advisory Group. The lost weekend from the storm lowered sales by as much as 0.5% points for the month, accounting for part of the miss (3.5% vs 5%) and setting the stage for more sluggish reports from retailers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 1 Comment
  • KR

    Kroger (NYSE:KR) drops 7% after reporting FQ2 results. Though the supermarket chain's quarterly...

    Kroger (NYSE:KR) drops 7% after reporting FQ2 results. Though the supermarket chain's quarterly numbers beat estimates, and its same-store sales forecast was slightly lifted, the company's gross margin declined 0.5% Y/Y, and it reiterated an FY11 EPS guidance range which falls short of a $1.97 consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • SGMO

    Shares of Sangamo Biosciences (SGMO +6%) pop after the company announces new HIV/AIDS results...

    Shares of Sangamo Biosciences (SGMO +6%) pop after the company announces new HIV/AIDS results from a study will be presented at a conference in Chicago later this month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • TBI

    Staffing companies are getting hit hard after Deutsche downgrades TrueBlue (TBI -7.6%) to Hold...

    Staffing companies are getting hit hard after Deutsche downgrades TrueBlue (TBI -7.6%) to Hold on lower revenue estimates tied to light demand for industrial staffing. Taking on collateral damage in the sector: KFY -7.3%, MAW -4.6%, KELYA -4.9%, HHGP -5.3%, RHI -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • UAL

    Select airline stocks charge out of the gate early, as some carriers gain back a little of the...

    Select airline stocks charge out of the gate early, as some carriers gain back a little of the ground lost from overwrought worries on the economy, fuel prices and the lost weekend from Hurricane Irene. Early gainers: UAL +3.4%, ALK +2%, JBLU +2%, LUV +1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (ULTA +11%) rocks a big gain after posting stellar Q2 results last night. The firm's...

    Ulta Salon (ULTA +11%) rocks a big gain after posting stellar Q2 results last night. The firm's surprise beat follows the trend of luxury retailers keeping sales moving along briskly - even in a weak economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • SCGLY

    European shares falling to new lows on the day. Stoxx 50 -3.5%. Euro continues to sink vs. the...

    European shares falling to new lows on the day. Stoxx 50 -3.5%. Euro continues to sink vs. the dollar, now -1.2% at $1.3719. SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) drops 3.6% after Jeffries' Peter Misek cuts shares to Underperform,...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) drops 3.6% after Jeffries' Peter Misek cuts shares to Underperform, just 3 weeks after upgrading them. In contrast with positive commentary from other analysts, Misek's sales checks suggest weak sales of RIM's latest hardware. He also thinks the company's QNX phones are being rushed, and will initially lack key features.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • TZOO

    Premarket gainers: TZOO +7%.Losers: VRSN -10%. XRA -6%. MT -5%. BBVA -4%. RBS -4%. ALU -4%. BCS...

    Premarket gainers: TZOO +7%.
    Losers: VRSN -10%. XRA -6%. MT -5%. BBVA -4%. RBS -4%. ALU -4%. BCS -5%. LULU -4%. RIMM -4%. LYG -4%. SI -3%. DB -3%. UBS -3%. MCD -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM

  • European shares and the euro are falling sharply in the past minutes. Stoxx 50 -2.3%. Reportedly...

    European shares and the euro are falling sharply in the past minutes. Stoxx 50 -2.3%. Reportedly retiring ECB member Stark was known to be less-than-thrilled with the bank's sovereign debt purchases. Bloomberg's TJ Marta reports on trader chatter of Greek default over the weekend.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • DRI

    Investors think Americans will dine out less and pick cheaper options, according to performance...

    Investors think Americans will dine out less and pick cheaper options, according to performance of stocks in the sector. The Bloomberg Full Service Restaurant Index is off 21% since July 5 led by DRI, CAKE and EAT, a much bigger decline than the Bloomberg Quick Service Restaurant Index with fast-food chain stalwarts like MCD and WEN - only down 5% for the same period.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • ABM

    ABM Industries (NYSE:ABM) reports Q2 income jumped 33%, but issues a stern warning for Q3 saying...

    ABM Industries (NYSE:ABM) reports Q2 income jumped 33%, but issues a stern warning for Q3 saying it became clear "the U.S. economy will be weaker than anticipated, impacting our clients and resulting in further price compression." The firm's CEO says a delay in passing federal appropriations will also impact results. Shares -2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM
  • LULU

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) falls 6.1% premarket after disclosing Q2 results and beating estimates....

    Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) falls 6.1% premarket after disclosing Q2 results and beating estimates. The company steered guidance for FY11 to revenue of $930M-$950M and EPS in a range of $1.10-$1.14, falling on the higher end of analyst estimates - but well-below the company's previous guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM | 3 Comments
